thumb.name: Festive Trees
thumb.verse: Whether you%26#146;re typing, word-processing, or writing longhand the old-fashioned way, personalised %3CB%3Estationery%3C/B%3E is a nice way to express yourself and impress your correspondent.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EYou'll need:%3C/B%3E A4 Paper. Use plain white paper, coloured paper or preprinted stationery stock.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E1. Click on %3CB%3EPersonalise and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Create %26 Print workspace. %3CBR%3E2. Personalise the text. Select the text to write over it or change size, colour and font style.%3CBR%3E3. For additional pages click %3Cb%3EAdd Page%3C/b%3E and follow the directions.%3CBR%3E4. Print your project.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EChoose a stationery style that fits your mood %26#150; whimsical, happy, serious, etc.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EFormal stationery traditionally includes the writer%26#146;s name and contact information. but don%26#146;t feel restricted to that. Specially chosen pictures and quotations can make your stationery uniquely yours. %3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EMany stationery projects have coordinating envelopes, labels or stickers you can Create %26 Print as well. %3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EYou may want to save your favourite stationery so that you can make more. Click %3CB%3ESave%3C/B%3E and follow the directions.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E
